body.p: Ohio attorney and soldier. Ohio native. Attended the United States Military Academy at West Point from 1844 to 1848. Attorney in St. Louis, Missouri and Fort Leavenworth, Kansas. Returned to Ohio in 1852. Served on the staff of Ohio Governor William Dennison in May 1861. Colonel of the 30th Ohio Volunteers (U.S.A.). Promoted to brigadier general on November 29, 1862. Commanded a division in the XVI Corps in 1863. Commanded the post of Louisville, Kentucky starting in February 1864. Mustered out of the service in 1866.
